messages.content: ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator is an extension for ComfyUI that allows generating images via the NovelAI API.

You can install ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator by cloning the repository into the 'custom_nodes' directory using the command 'git clone https://github.com/bedovyy/ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator' or by using the 'Install via Git URL' option from the ComfyUI-Manager extension.
What do you need to set up before using the ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator nodes?

Before using the ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator nodes, you need to set the NAI_ACCESS_TOKEN in the 'ComfyUI/.env' file. You can obtain a persistent API token from the NovelAI webpage under User Settings > Account > Get Persistent API Token.
In which category can the ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator nodes be found?
The ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator nodes are located in the 'NovelAI' category.
What is the purpose of the 'PromptToNAID' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator?
The 'PromptToNAID' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator converts ComfyUI's prompt format, which uses '()' or '(word:weight)' for emphasis, to NovelAI's format, which uses '{}' and '[]'.
What is the default model used by the 'GenerateNAID' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator?
The default model used by the 'GenerateNAID' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator is 'nai-diffusion-3' (NAI Diffusion Anime V3).
What can you do with the 'NetworkOption' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator?

With the 'NetworkOption' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator, you can set timeout or retry options for the image generation requests. You can also choose to ignore errors, in which case the result will be a 1x1 size grayscale image.
What happens to the generated images when using the 'GenerateNAID' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator?
When using the 'GenerateNAID' node in ComfyUI_NAIDGenerator, all generated images are saved as 'output/NAI_autosave_12345_.png' to keep the original metadata.
